Subject: Provision of PSOs to_the Protectees wa

It has been brought to my riotice that often passengers having
security grading travel after alighting from the aircraft to the exit point
of the terminal building without any personal protection. As the
area upto the segregation point is only controlled and not restricted,
it is quite possible that a person with the intention of harming the
protectee gains entry into such areas of terminal.

You are, therefore, requested to ensure that over and above
the protocol officer, two PSOs in plain clothes are detailed with such
persons for escorting them from the aircraft to the point outside the
terminal where their own or security provided by the local police
takes over. The same procedure should also be followed by us with
regard to such protectees when they arrive at the terminal for
boarding the aircraft i.e. for their journey from the eritry point of the
terminal to the aircraft. It should also be ensured that both the
protocol officers as well as the PSOs are in plain clothes. Protocol
work should never be done in uniform. CASOs will be personally
responsible for compliance of these directions.
